meanings.definition: Strongest or most resilient in character or temperament.
meanings.sent1: She is the toughest player on the team, always giving her best.
meanings.sent2: The lion proved to be the toughest animal in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: Even the toughest cookie crumbled under pressure.
meanings.sent4: His toughest challenge was climbing the steep mountain of success.
meanings.sent5: Her toughest decision was whether to stand up for what is right.

meanings.sent1: The toughest puzzle took hours to solve.
meanings.sent2: Running a marathon is one of the toughest physical challenges.
meanings.sent3: The toughest part of the race was the uphill climb.
meanings.sent4: Overcoming his fear of heights was his toughest battle.
meanings.sent5: The toughest math problem stumped even the brightest students.

meanings.sent1: The toughest punishment for him was being grounded for a week.
meanings.sent2: The winter storm brought the toughest weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The toughest critique of his work left him feeling discouraged.
meanings.sent4: The toughest judge in the competition was known for being fair.
meanings.sent5: The toughest discipline led to the greatest improvement in behavior.
